Text:
When I am trying to use the [EA iffw.c library][2] for writing an IFF file, I can't get past the StartWGroup() call. It fails in IFFWriteBytes() because context->ckHdr.ckSize is zero. Inside IFFWriteBytes() there is an if() which checks that  (size) != szNotYetKnown. (szNotYetKnown is a constant.) The [example][1] seems to indicate it should work, but I can't see how.


  [1]: http://bullet.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Extras/iff/iffCreateTest/main.cpp
  [2]: http://bullet.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Extras/iff/

When I am trying to use the [EA iffw.c library][2] for writing an IFF file, I can't get past the StartWGroup() call. It fails in IFFWriteBytes() because context->ckHdr.ckSize is zero. Inside IFFWriteBytes() there is an if() which checks that  (size) != szNotYetKnown. (szNotYetKnown is a constant.) The [example][1] seems to indicate it should work, but I can't see how.
IFFWriteBytes() returns CLIENT_ERROR because nBytes is 4 - I am trying to save a 32 bit int.

My failing code:

    outfp = fopen(outfile, "wb");
    
    ifferr = OpenWIFF(outfp, &filec, szNotYetKnown);

    if (ifferr) {
        return 2;
    }

    ifferr = StartWGroup(&filec, LIST, sizeof (ID_NATAMI_FLASH), ID_NATAMI_FLASH, &listc);

    if (ifferr) {
        printf("ifferr: %d\\n", ifferr);
        return 3;
    }
    

The last fails, StartWGroup().

<sup>Question is not really about Amiga, but this file format was popular on Amiga.</sup>

  [1]: http://bullet.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Extras/iff/iffCreateTest/main.cpp
  [2]: http://bullet.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Extras/iff/

When I am trying to use the [EA iffw.c library][1] for writing an IFF file, I can't get past the StartWGroup() call. It fails in IFFWriteBytes() because context->ckHdr.ckSize is zero. Inside IFFWriteBytes() there is an if() which checks that  (size) != szNotYetKnown. (szNotYetKnown is a constant.) The [example][2] seems to indicate it should work, but I can't see how.
IFFWriteBytes() returns CLIENT_ERROR because nBytes is 4 - I am trying to save a 32 bit int.

My failing code:

    outfp = fopen(outfile, "wb");
    
    ifferr = OpenWIFF(outfp, &filec, szNotYetKnown);

    if (ifferr) {
        return 2;
    }

    ifferr = StartWGroup(&filec, LIST, sizeof (ID_NATAMI_FLASH), ID_NATAMI_FLASH, &listc);

    if (ifferr) {
        printf("ifferr: %d\\n", ifferr);
        return 3;
    }
    

The last fails, StartWGroup().


*IFF is, like XML, simple enough that I could just generate it without a library, but it would be nice to make use a of once common and well tested library.*

<sup>Question is not really about Amiga, but this file format was popular on Amiga. BTW, did you know [AIFF, RIFF and so on are basically IFF][3]?</sup>


  [1]: http://bullet.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Extras/iff/
  [2]: http://bullet.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Extras/iff/iffCreateTest/main.cpp
  [3]: http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/power/library/pa-spec16/

Inside IFFWriteBytes() there is an if() which checks that  (size) != szNotYetKnown. (szNotYetKnown is a constant.) The [example][2] seems to indicate it should work, but I can't see how.
IFFWriteBytes() returns CLIENT_ERROR because nBytes is 4 - I am trying to save a 32 bit int.

My failing code:

    outfp = fopen(outfile, "wb");
    
    ifferr = OpenWIFF(outfp, &filec, szNotYetKnown);

    if (ifferr) {
        return 2;
    }

    ifferr = StartWGroup(&filec, LIST, sizeof (ID_NATAMI_FLASH), ID_NATAMI_FLASH, &listc);

<sup>Question is not really about Amiga, but this file format was popular on Amiga. By the way, did you know [DjVU][3], [RMFF][4], [AIFF, RIFF and many other formats are IFF or slight variations][5]?</sup>
